alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 3:30AM MST until December 19 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 4500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning for elevations above 4500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory for elevations below 4500 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
